intro: Geissanthus cogolloi, commonly known as the Cogollo's geissanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant is evergreen, with narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to the high-altitude, cool climate in which it grows. It is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss. Geissanthus cogolloi plays a unique role in its ecosystem, supporting specific pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native environment.
